intro: Syndesmanthus ciliatus, commonly known as the silky broom. It is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil, and belongs to the Leguminosae family. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. Its leaves are pinnately compound and have a soft, silky texture, which gives it its common name. Syndesmanthus ciliatus is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage and seasonal blooms.
